alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 11:35AM EDT until May 02 at 4:24AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Maine... Carrabassett River At North Anson affecting Somerset and Franklin Counties. For the Carrabassett River...including North Anson...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Carrabassett River at North Anson. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Katie Crotch Road begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM EDT Monday the stage was 19.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:15 AM EDT Monday was 19.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 21.2 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening to 8.9 feet early Wednesday morning. It will rise to 9.1 feet Wednesday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
